question_1.question: What is the primary function of the View menu in the TimeXtender user interface?

options.option_b: To customize the user interface display

question_1.explanation: The View menu in TimeXtender allows users to customize the user interface by toggling the display of different attributes, enhancing the user experience.

question_2.question: In the TimeXtender user interface, how can you add a description to an object?

options.option_b: By selecting the object and pressing Ctrl+D
options.option_c: By right-clicking on the object and selecting Description
options.option_d: By dragging the object to the description pane

question_2.explanation: Descriptions are added to objects in TimeXtender by right-clicking on the object and selecting Description from the context menu.

question_3.question: What happens when 'Data types' is checked in the View menu of TimeXtender?

options.option_a: Data types are hidden in the interface
options.option_b: Data types are added as a prefix to field names
options.option_c: Data types are added as a postfix to field names
options.option_d: Data types are converted to a default type

question_3.explanation: When 'Data types' is checked in the View menu, field data types are added as a postfix to their names, providing clarity on the type of data each field contains.

question_4.question: What does the TimeXtender user interface display when 'Highlight descriptions' is enabled?

options.option_a: It highlights the description text in yellow
options.option_b: It displays objects with descriptions in bold text
options.option_c: It underlines the objects with descriptions
options.option_d: It creates a pop-up window with descriptions

question_4.explanation: When 'Highlight descriptions' is checked, objects in the tree that have a description are displayed with bold text, making them stand out for easy identification.

question_5.question: What is indicated by 'System fields' being checked in the TimeXtender View menu?

options.option_a: All fields are treated as system fields
options.option_b: System fields are hidden from the tables
options.option_c: System fields are displayed at the top of tables
options.option_d: System fields are displayed at the bottom of tables

question_5.explanation: When 'System fields' is checked in the View menu, system fields are displayed at the bottom of tables, distinguishing them from user-defined fields.

question_6.question: What does 'Uneven mappings' refer to in the context of the TimeXtender user interface?

options.option_a: Tables with the same number of fields and mappings
options.option_b: Tables with fields that have inconsistent mapping counts
options.option_c: Tables with fields that have no mappings
options.option_d: Tables with fields that have been mapped to multiple sources

question_6.explanation: The 'Uneven mappings' option, when checked, displays the number of mappings for tables with uneven mapping, indicating tables where fields have different numbers of mappings.
